metadata.subject: Invitation to be a featured guest of Poetry in America

relationships.description: Elisa New is the Powell M. Cabot Professor of American Literature at Harvard University
Elisa New is the Director and Host of Poetry in America
Collaboration on an online course for medical professionals

analysis.purpose: To invite Ms. Williams to be a featured guest on the Poetry in America series
analysis.significance: Shows the prestigious nature of the Poetry in America program and its connections to high-profile individuals across various fields

notable_quotes: You are the ideal reader for this poem.
I would be very honored to work with you.

blackmail_indicators.description: No indicators of blackmail or coercion present; this is a straightforward professional invitation

illegal_activity.description: No illegal activity mentioned or suggested in this document

details: Document references the Poetry in America television series that airs on public television stations and streams via Amazon Prime and other services

public_knowledge.context: Poetry in America is a publicly broadcast television series featuring high-profile guests, making this type of invitation and participation likely to be public knowledge

analysis.summary: Elisa New, a Harvard professor and director of Poetry in America, invites Ms. Williams to be a featured guest on the television series to read and interpret Sharon Olds' poem 'The Language of the Brag,' highlighting the prestigious nature of the program and its previous high-profile participants.
